channel.title: Ubuntu brightness issue
channel.description: My laptop brightness control worked great in 9.10, unfortunately, it doesn't work at all, I can't change brightness with the controls, (fn key isn't functioning. Suggestions?

item.title: Ubuntu brightness issue
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I enjoyed this rant.

item.title: Ubuntu brightness issue
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:5, topic:339681”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=436059.msg3203371#msg3203371 date=1273539622]

[quote author=Koolvin link=topic=436059.msg3203365#msg3203365 date=1273539318]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=436059.msg3203306#msg3203306 date=1273535100]
and you intend on being a computer technician…
[/quote]The problem is beyond my knowledge, and obviously yours too.
[/quote]hence as to why YOU ARE NOT CAPABLE OF BEING A TECHNICIAN
[/quote]There is no way to know the solution to every problem that every computer can have with every operating system, don’t act like you know the ropes, you are 15 years old.[/quote]No, but being unable to solve problems related to the incapacity to properly interact with your operating system obviously disqualify you from being one. The difference between you and me is that I never claimed to “know the ropes”, while you did (by attempting to fetch a job as a technician).

The reason as to why I don’t know the solution is because I don’t use ubuntu, however I’m well aware of how to configure the OS I use, unlike yourself.

Now quit attempting to redeem your lowly status on these forums since you never will, leave and don’t come back.

Read full topic
